Are you explictly setting ANT_HOME?
You are making use of {$ant.home} for your xdoclet.path so you will need to set 
ANT_HOME on the Ant classpath either globally (using the Ant Preferences) or on 
the Classpath tab for the ant launch configuration (available in the latest 
builds). This is one of the major differences from using Ant on the cmd line 
and Ant in Eclipse; cmd line Ant sets ANT_HOME for you, in eclipse you need to 
set it yourself.

Eclipse cannot automatically set ANT_HOME...what would it set it too?

You can set ANT_HOME...set it using the "Set ANT_HOME" on the preferences or on 
a per configuration basis.

Wouldn't it be C:\Program Files\eclipse\eclipse\plugins\org.apache.ant_1.5.3 
for example?

Ant requires a very specific layout to ANT_HOME (requires a lib directory etc). 
The plugin provided within Eclipse does not mimic this behavior.
